member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMID.AddCHMIDResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Applies the specified tags to the specified Amazon Chime SDK identity resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMID.AddCHMIDResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.ChimeSDKIdentity.Model.TagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMID.AddCHMIDResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceARN parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceARN' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMID.AddCHMIDResourceTagCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMID.GetCHMIDAppInstanceCmdlet
member.summary: Returns the full details of an AppInstance.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMID.GetCHMIDAppInstanceCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'AppInstance'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.ChimeSDKIdentity.Model.DescribeAppInstanceResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.ChimeSDKIdentity.Model.DescribeAppInstanceResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMID.GetCHMIDAppInstanceCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the AppInstanceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^AppInstanceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the AppInstanceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^AppInstanceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMID.NewCHMIDAppInstanceCmdlet
member.summary:
Creates an Amazon Chime SDK messaging AppInstance under an AWS account. Only SDK messaging customers use this API. CreateAppInstance supports idempotency behavior as described in the AWS API Standard.
identity

para.para: The metadata of the AppInstance. Limited to a 1KB string in UTF-8.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMID.NewCHMIDAppInstanceCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'AppInstanceArn'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.ChimeSDKIdentity.Model.CreateAppInstanceResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.ChimeSDKIdentity.Model.CreateAppInstanceResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMID.NewCHMIDAppInstanceCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Name parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Name' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMID.NewCHMIDAppInstanceCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMID.NewCHMIDAppInstanceAdminCmdlet
member.summary:
Promotes an AppInstanceUser to an AppInstanceAdmin. The promoted user can perform the following actions.
ChannelModerator actions across all channels in the AppInstance.
DeleteChannelMessage actions.
Only an AppInstanceUser can be promoted to an AppInstanceAdmin role.

para.para: The ARN of the administrator of the current AppInstance.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMID.NewCHMIDAppInstanceAdminCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMID.NewCHMIDAppInstanceUserCmdlet
member.summary: Creates a user under an Amazon Chime AppInstance. The request consists of a unique appInstanceUserId and Name for that user.

para.para: The ARN of the AppInstance request.
The user ID of the AppInstance.
The token assigned to the user requesting an AppInstance.
The request's metadata. Limited to a 1KB string in UTF-8.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMID.NewCHMIDAppInstanceUserCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'AppInstanceUserArn'. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the AppInstanceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^AppInstanceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMID.RegisterCHMIDAppInstanceUserEndpointCmdlet
member.summary: Registers an endpoint under an Amazon Chime AppInstanceUser. The endpoint receives messages for a user. For push notifications, the endpoint is a mobile device used to receive mobile push notifications for a user.

para.para: Boolean that controls whether the AppInstanceUserEndpoint is opted in to receive messages. ALL indicates the endpoint receives all messages. NONE indicates the endpoint receives no messages.
The idempotency token for each client request.
The device token for the GCM, APNS, and APNS_SANDBOX endpoint types.
The ARN of the resource to which the endpoint belongs.
The type of the AppInstanceUserEndpoint. Supported types:

li.para: APNS: The mobile notification service for an Apple device.
APNS_SANDBOX: The sandbox environment of the mobile notification service for an Apple device.
GCM: The mobile notification service for an Android device.

para.para: Populate the ResourceArn value of each type as PinpointAppArn.
The VOIP device token for the APNS and APNS_SANDBOX endpoint types.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMID.RegisterCHMIDAppInstanceUserEndpointCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.ChimeSDKIdentity.Model.RegisterAppInstanceUserEndpointResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.ChimeSDKIdentity.Model.RegisterAppInstanceUserEndpointResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CHMID.RegisterCHMIDAppInstanceUserEndpointCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
